columns.text: This exercise requires us to compute the different financial ratios of Smolira Golf Corp.

## Requirement 1-  Short-term solvency ratios
**a. Current ratio**

The **Current ratio** is the most used *liquidity measure* which aims to determine the firmâ€™s ability to pay its current obligations using only its current assets.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Current ratio.

|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Current assets |$112,563 | 
|Current liabilities |$86,752 |

The computation for the current ratio will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Current ratio}&=\dfrac{\text{Current asset}}{\text{Current Liabilities}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$112,563 }}{\text{\$86,752 }}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{1.30 times}
\end{aligned}$$
\
Smolira Golf Corporation has $1.30 current assets available for every $1 current debt.

**b. Quick ratio**

**Quick ratio, also known as (Acid-test ratio)** is similar to the current ratio however, the inventory of the company is excluded here in computing the total current assets. 
\
The reason is that inventory is the least liquid current asset and its book value is not reliable to ascertain its real value.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Quick ratio.

|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Current assets |$112,563 | 
|Inventory| $44,336|
|Current liabilities |$86,752 |

The computation for the Quick ratio will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Quick ratio}&=\dfrac{\text{Current asset - Inventory}}{\text{Current Liabilities}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$112,563 - \$44,336 }}{\text{\$86,752 }}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{0.79 times}
\end{aligned}$$
\
For $1 current obligation of Smolira Golf Corporation, it only has $0.79 quick assets available to pay for it.

**c. Cash ratio**

**Cash ratio** is a more conservative liquidity measure, it only considers the cash of the company in determining its liquidity.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Cash ratio.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Cash| 439,350|
|Current liabilities |$86,752 |

The computation for the Cash ratio will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Cash ratio}&=\dfrac{\text{Cash}}{\text{Current Liabilities}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$39,350}}{\text{\$86,752}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{0.45 times}
\end{aligned}$$
\
The company can only pay $0.45 for every $1 of its current liabilities.

## Requirement 2- Asset utilization ratios
**d. Total asset turnover**

**Total asset turnover** is used to measure the efficiency of the firm in managing its total assets to generate sales.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the asset turnover ratio.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Sales| $531,750|
|Total assets |$615,435|

The computation for the Total asset turnover will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Total asset turnover}&=\dfrac{\text{Sales}}{\text{Total assets}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$531,750}}{\text{\$615,435}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{0.86 times}
\end{aligned}$$
\
For every $1 asset invested, the company generated $0.86 in sales.

**e. Inventory turnover**

**Inventory turnover** shows how many times the average inventory was replaced and sold during the period.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Inventory turnover.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Cost of goods sold| $377,294|
|Beginning inventory|$34,495| 
|Ending inventory|$44,336|

The computation for the Inventory turnover will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Inventory turnover}&=\dfrac{\text{Cost of goods sold}}{\text{Average Inventory}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$377,294}}{{\text{(\$34,495 + \$44,336)}\div 2}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$377,294}}{\text{\$39,415.5}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{9.57 times}
\end{aligned}$$
\
Smolira Golf Corporation had sold its average inventory 9.57 times.

**f. Receivables turnover**

**Receivables turnover**indicates how many times the company collects receivables from its customers during the period.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Receivables turnover.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Sales| $531,750|
|Beginning Accounts receivable|$16,911| 
|Ending Acounts receivable|$28,877|

The computation for the Receivables turnover will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Receivable turnover}&=\dfrac{\text{Sales}}{\text{Average Accounts receivable}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$531,750}}{{\text{(\$16,911+ \$28,877)}\div 2}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$531,750}}{\text{\$22,894}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{23.23 times}
\end{aligned}$$
\
Smolira Golf Corporation had collected its receivables 23.23 times during the year.

## Requirement 3- Long-term solvency ratios

**g. Total debt ratio**

**Total debt ratio** shows by what percentage of the total assets is financed by creditors.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Long-term debt ratio.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Total assets |$615,435| 
|Total equity| $388,683|

The computation for the Total debt ratio will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Total debt ratio}&=\dfrac{\text{(Total assets - Total equity)}}{\text{Total assets}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$615,435- \$388,683}}{\text{\$615,435}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$226,752}}{\text{\$615,435}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{0.37 }
\end{aligned}$$
\
The 27% of the total assets of the company is funded through debt.

**h. Debt-equity ratio**

**Debt-equity ratio** is used to show the relationship between the total liabilities and the total equity. It indicates if the company is highly leveraged or not.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Debt to equity ratio.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Total liabilities| $226,752|
|Total equity| $388,683|

The computation for the Debt-equity ratio will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Debt-equity ratio }&=\dfrac{\text{Total liabilities}}{\text{Total equity}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$226,752}}{\text{\$388,683}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{0.53}
\end{aligned}$$
\
The company has $0.53 debt for every $1 equity.

**i. Equity multiplier**

**Equity multiplier** is a financial leverage ratio and it is a variation of debt ratio. 
\
It is used to indicate how much of the total assets are financed by the owners or shareholders.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Equity multiplier.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Total assets| $615,435|
|Total equity| $388,683|

The computation for the Equity multiplier will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Equity multiplier }&=\dfrac{\text{Total assets}}{\text{Total equity}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$615,435}}{\text{\$388,683}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{1.58}
\end{aligned}$$
\
The equity multiplier for Smolira Golf Corporation is 1.58.

**j. Times interest earned ratio**

**Times interest earned ratio** indicates how many times the firm can cover the interest expenses using its earnings before tax and interest.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Times interest earned ratio.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|EBIT| $107,770|
|Interest| $20,650|

The computation for the Times interest earned ratio will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Times interest earned ratio  }&=\dfrac{\text{EBIT}}{\text{Interest}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$107,770}}{\text{\$20,650}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{5.22}
\end{aligned}$$
\
Smolira Golf Corporation can cover its interest expenses 5.22 times.

**k. Cash coverage ratio**

**Cash coverage ratio** is similar to the Times interest earned ratio except that the depreciation expense is being added back to the earnings.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Cash coverage ratio.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|EBIT| $107,770|
\Depreciation| $46,686|
|Interest| $20,650|

The computation for the Cash coverage ratio will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Cash coverage ratio }&=\dfrac{\text{EBIT - Depreciation}}{\text{Interest}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{(\$107,770 + \$46,686)}}{\text{\$20,650}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$154,456}}{\text{\$20,650}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{7.48 times}
\end{aligned}$$
\
Smolira Golf Corporation can cover its interest expenses 7.48 times.

## Requirement 4-  Profitability ratio

**l. Profit margin**

**Profit Margin** is one of the widely used financial ratios.
\
It indicates how much a firm can earn in every $1 sale. The higher the profit margin is, the better.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Profit margin.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Sales| $531,750|
|Net Income| $65,340|

The computation for the Profit margin will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Profit margin}&=\dfrac{\text{Net income}}{\text{Sales}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$65,340}}{\text{\$531,750}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{.1229 or 12.29\%}
\end{aligned}$$
\
Smolira Golf Corporation earned $0.1229 for every $1 sales

**m. Return on assets**

**Return on assets** measures the efficiency of the firm in managing its assets to generate income. It will show how much profit is earned in every $1 of assets.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Return on assets.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Total assets| $615,435|
|Net Income| $65,340|

The computation for the Return on assets will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Return on assets }&=\dfrac{\text{Net income}}{\text{Total assets}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$65,340}}{\text{\$615,435}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{.1062 or 10.62\%}
\end{aligned}$$
\
Smolira Golf Corporation earned $0.1062 for every $1 of assets.

**n. Return on equity**

**Return on equity** is a profitability measure that indicates how efficient the firm in using the total equity to generate income. 
\
It shows how much profit is earned in every $1 of equity.

Extracted from the balance sheet of Smolira Golf Corp. are the following figures that will be used in the computation of the Return on Equity.
|Given |Amounts | 
|--|--:| 
|Total equity| $388,683|
|Net Income| $65,340|

The computation for the Return on equity will be as follows:
$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Return on equity}&=\dfrac{\text{Net income}}{\text{Total equity}}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{\$65,340}}{\text{\$388,683}}\\[15pt]
&=\textbf{.1681 or 16.81\%}
\end{aligned}$$
\
Smolira Golf Corporation earned $0.1681 for every $1 of equity.

textbook.authors: Bradford D. Jordan, Randolph W. Westerfield, Stephen A. Ross
textbook.title: Fundamentals of Corporate Finance
